panels.description:
**Dirty** Memory waiting to be written back to disk

**Bounce** Memory used for block device bounce buffers

**Mapped** Files which have been mmaped, such as libraries

**KernelStack** The memory the kernel stack uses. This is not reclaimable.
panels.title: NUMA Memory Usage Types

panels.description: Memory successfully allocated on this node as intended.
panels.title: NUMA Allocation Hits

panels.description:
**Memory missed** is allocated on a node despite the process preferring some different node.

**Memory foreign** is intended for a node, but actually allocated on some different node.
panels.title: NUMA Allocation Missed

panels.description:
**Active anonymous memory** that has been used more recently and usually not swapped out.

**Inactive anonymous memory** that has not been used recently and can be swapped out.
panels.title: Anonymous Memory

panels.description:
**Active(file)** Pagecache memory that has been used more recently and usually not reclaimed until needed

**Inactive(file)** Pagecache memory that can be reclaimed without huge performance impact
panels.title: NUMA File (PageCache)

panels.description: **Shmem** Total used shared memory (shared between several processes, thus including RAM disks, SYS-V-IPC and BSD like SHMEM)
panels.title: Shared Memory

panels.description:
**Total** Number of hugepages being allocated by the kernel (Defined with vm.nr_hugepages)

**Free** The number of hugepages not being allocated by a process

**Surp**  The number of hugepages in the pool above the value in vm.nr_hugepages. The maximum number of surplus hugepages is controlled by vm.nr_overcommit_hugepages.
panels.title: HugePages Statistic

panels.description: Memory allocated on a node while a process was running on it.
panels.title: Local Processes

panels.description: Memory allocated on a node while a process was running on some other node.

targets.expr:
sum(rate(node_memory_numa_other_node_total{instance="$host", node="$node"}[$interval])) or
sum(irate(node_memory_numa_other_node_total{instance="$host", node="$node"}[5m])) * 100 /
(sum(rate(node_memory_numa_other_node_total{instance="$host", node="$node"}[$interval])) or
sum(irate(node_memory_numa_other_node_total{instance="$host", node="$node"}[5m])) + 
sum(rate(node_memory_numa_local_node_total{instance="$host"}[$interval])) or
sum(irate(node_memory_numa_local_node_total{instance="$host"}[$interval])))

panels.title: Remote Processes

panels.description:
**Slab** allocation is a memory management mechanism intended for the efficient memory allocation of kernel objects.

**SReclaimable** The part of the Slab that might be reclaimed (such as caches).

**SUnreclaim** The part of the Slab that can't be reclaimed under memory pressure
panels.title: Slab Memory

panels.description:
**Dirty** Memory waiting to be written back to disk

**Bounce** Memory used for block device bounce buffers

**Mapped** Files which have been mmaped, such as libraries

**KernelStack** The memory the kernel stack uses. This is not reclaimable.
panels.title: Node $node - NUMA Memory Usage Types

panels.description: Memory successfully allocated on this node as intended.
panels.title: Node $node - NUMA Allocation Hits

panels.description:
**Memory missed** is allocated on a node despite the process preferring some different node.

**Memory foreign** is intended for a node, but actually allocated on some different node.

targets.expr:
rate(node_memory_numa_numa_miss_total{instance="$host", node="$node"}[$interval]) or
irate(node_memory_numa_numa_miss_total{instance="$host", node="$node"}[5m]) * 100 /
(rate(node_memory_numa_numa_hit_total{instance="$host", node="$node"}[$interval]) or
irate(node_memory_numa_numa_hit_total{instance="$host", node="$node"}[5m]) + 
rate(node_memory_numa_numa_miss_total{instance="$host", node="$node"}[$interval]) or
irate(node_memory_numa_numa_miss_total{instance="$host", node="$node"}[5m]))

panels.title: Node $node - NUMA Allocation Missed/Foreign

panels.description:
**Active** Anonymous memory that has been used more recently and usually not swapped out

**Inactive** Anonymous memory that has not been used recently and can be swapped out
panels.title: Node $node - Anonymous Memory

panels.description:
**Active(file)** Pagecache memory that has been used more recently and usually not reclaimed until needed

**Inactive(file)** Pagecache memory that can be reclaimed without huge performance impact

**Free** The number of hugepages not being allocated by a process

**Surp**  The number of hugepages in the pool above the value in vm.nr_hugepages. The maximum number of surplus hugepages is controlled by vm.nr_overcommit_hugepages.
panels.title: Node $node - HugePages Statistic

panels.title: Node $node - Local Processes

panels.title: Node $node - Remote Processes

**Slab** allocation is a memory management mechanism intended for the efficient memory allocation of kernel objects.

**SReclaimable** The part of the Slab that might be reclaimed (such as caches).

**SUnreclaim** The part of the Slab that can't be reclaimed under memory pressure
panels.title: Node $node - Slab Memory
